sen.j: 寺院諸法度（じいんしょはっと）は、江戸時代、徳川幕府が仏教教団に対して定めた諸法度の総称である。
sen.e: Jiin Sho-Hatto is a general term for a set of regulations that applied to the Buddhism religious community by the Tokugawa Shogunate in Edo period.

sen.j: ただ、定まった呼称はなく、文献によっては「諸宗寺院法度（しょしゅうじいんはっと）」・「諸宗諸本山法度（しょしゅうしょほんざんはっと）」などの呼称が用いられる事もある。
sen.e: However, there is no fixed proper name, therefore, several names such as "Shoshu Jiin Hatto" (Act for temples belonging to each sect) and "Shoshu Sho-honzan Hatto" (Act for each head temple belonging to each sect) are used in literatures.

However, as there is no fixed proper name, several names such as "Shoshu Jiin Hatto" (Acts Relating to the Temples of Each Sect) and "Shoshu Sho-honzan Hatto" (Acts Relating to the Head Temple of Each Sect) have also been used formally.

sen.j: 儒教、とりわけ朱子学を重んじる政策をとった江戸幕府も、その一方で、寺領を安堵し、伽藍の整備をも推進していたが、それと同時に僧侶の統制をはかる目的から、各宗の僧に対して設けられたのが、寺院諸法度である。
sen.e: While the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) adopted a policy to respect Confucianism, particularly Neo-Confucianism, it established Jiin Sho-Hatto for Buddhist priests belonging to each sect aiming to control those priests, as well as it approved the ownership of temple estate and promoted the maintenance of Buddhist temples.

sen.j: 五山十刹諸山法度においては、従来の「（鹿苑）僧録」、「蔭涼職」が廃止され、1619年、江戸に「（金地院）僧録）」が新設され、黒衣の宰相崇伝が任命された。
sen.e: With the promulgation of Gozan-Jissatsu Shozan Hatto, traditional posts of "Rokuon Soroku" (highest-ranking priest who takes charge of managing personal affairs, ranking temples and others) and "Inryoshiki" (corresponding officer of Shogun and Soroku) were abolished, instead a new post of "Konchiin Soroku" (Soroku staying at Konchi-in sub temple of Nanzen-ji Temple) was established by appointing Suden, the prime minister in a priest's robe, to the post in 1619.

sen.j: その当初は、この新たな僧録によって禅宗全体の統制をはかったが、その統率は五山派のみにしか及ばなかった。
sen.e: Initially, the Edo bakufu tried to control the entire Zen sect by this new Soroku, although the leadership had an effect only on the Gozan-ha (group of five first-class temples in Zen sect).

sen.j: 崇伝没後の1635年、寺社奉行が設けられると、寺院の管掌は寺社奉行が取り仕切ることとなり、僧録の権限は更に縮小されることとなった。
sen.e: After the death of Suden, the jisha-bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines), which was established in 1635, took charge of the management of temples, with the result that the authority of Soroku was reduced furthermore.
